text:
# Login Issues – NetBanking

- **Forgot Password**:
 - Use the “Forgot Password” link on the NetBanking login page.
 - Reset password using registered mobile/email authentication.

- **Account Locked After Failed Attempts**:
 - Accounts may be locked after 3 consecutive failed password/OTP attempts.
 - Wait 30 minutes before retrying, or use “Forgot Password” to reset.
 - Contact customer support if still locked.

- **OTP Not Received**:
 - Verify your registered mobile number is active.
 - Check for SMS delays with your telecom provider.
 - Ensure “Do Not Disturb (DND)” is disabled for transactional SMS.

# NetBanking – Common Troubleshooting Steps

- **Check Connectivity**: Ensure your internet connection is stable.
- **Browser Compatibility**: Use supported browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Edge). Update to the latest version.
- **Clear Cache & Cookies**: Clear browser cache and cookies to remove corrupted session data.
- **Disable Extensions**: Turn off ad-blockers or extensions that may interfere with login pages.
- **Try Another Device**: Attempt login from a different device to isolate device-specific issues.
- **Scheduled Maintenance**: Check for maintenance windows announced on the bank’s status page.
- **Account Status**: Ensure your account is active and not dormant. Dormant accounts may restrict online access.

# Open a Fixed Deposit (FD) – NetBanking & Mobile App

> Purpose: High-level steps and requirements to open an FD account via digital channels. Avoid PII and never request sensitive data in chat.

## Eligibility & Prerequisites
- You must be a **KYC-compliant** existing customer with at least one operative account (e.g., Savings).
- Your **NetBanking / Mobile Banking** must be **active**.
- Ensure sufficient **available balance** if funding from an existing account.

## Steps – NetBanking (Web)
1. **Login** to NetBanking (do not share credentials in chat).
2. Navigate to **Deposits** → **Open Fixed Deposit**.
3. Choose:
 - **Funding account** (e.g., Savings)
 - **Deposit amount**
 - **Tenure** (days/months/years)
 - **Interest payout**: Cumulative (at maturity) or Non-cumulative (monthly/quarterly)
4. Review the **displayed interest rate** and **maturity value** (auto-calculated).
5. Read & accept **T&C** (premature withdrawal penalties may apply).
6. **Confirm**. You’ll receive an **FD advice/receipt** in the secure inbox or as a downloadable PDF.

## Steps – Mobile Banking (App)
1. Launch the app and **sign in**.
2. Tap **Deposits** → **Open FD**.
3. Select **funding account**, **amount**, **tenure**, and **payout option**.
4. Verify **rate** & **maturity details** on the confirmation screen.
5. Accept **T&C** and **confirm**. Save the **FD receipt**.

## Notes & Best Practices
- **Senior citizen** option must be selected if applicable to reflect the rate benefit.
- **Partial funding** or **multiple FDs**: If supported, you can split amount by creating multiple FDs.
- **Nomination**: Add/update nomination as per the on-screen flow.
- **Premature Closure**: Allowed as per policy; could attract penalty and differential rate.

## Troubleshooting
- **FD option not visible**: Check if your account is **dormant** or if **maintenance** is ongoing.
- **Rate not loading**: Refresh session; try another browser/device; verify network stability.
- **Payment failed**: Check av

**: Check if your account is **dormant** or if **maintenance** is ongoing.
- **Rate not loading**: Refresh session; try another browser/device; verify network stability.
- **Payment failed**: Check available balance/limits; retry; contact support if debited without FD creation (the amount is typically auto-reversed per policy timelines).

# FD Premature Closure – Policy Overview

- Premature closure may be **allowed** but can attract:
 - **Penalty** as per the bank policy.
 - **Lower applicable interest** (rate corresponding to the actual run period) rather than the booked rate.
- Partial closure may or may not be available; check product terms.
- Proceeds are typically credited to the **linked operative account** after closure.

## Digital Steps (if enabled)
1. NetBanking/Mobile → **Deposits** → **FD** → **Premature Closure**.
2. Select FD, review **penalty/interest adjustment**, and **confirm**.
3. Save closure advice for records.

If the option is not visible, visit the **branch** with valid ID proof.

# KYC and Compliance

- **KYC Pending**:
 - Accounts with incomplete KYC may face restrictions on transactions.
 - Visit branch or use online KYC update portal to complete verification.

- **Document Upload Errors**:
 - Upload clear, valid documents in accepted formats (PDF/JPEG).
 - File size must not exceed system limits (typically 2 MB per file).

- **Dormant Accounts**:
 - Accounts may become dormant after 2 years of inactivity.
 - To reactivate, perform a transaction at branch or NetBanking after KYC verification.

# Common Banking Charges and Fees

- **ATM Withdrawals**:
 - First 5 transactions per month free at own-bank ATMs.
 - Charges apply for additional withdrawals.

- **Minimum Balance Penalty**:
 - Falling below minimum average balance may attract penalties.
 - Check your account type for applicable limits.

- **Cheque Bounce Charges**:
 - Applicable if cheque is dishonoured due to insufficient funds.
 - Varies by account type.

- **NEFT/IMPS/RTGS Charges**:
 - NEFT/IMPS: Free in many banks via NetBanking.
 - RTGS: May attract nominal fees depending on amount and channel.

# Balance Enquiry – Troubleshooting

- **Zero Balance Displayed**:
 - Verify if any recent transactions were posted.
 - Check if pending transactions have temporarily reduced balance.
 - Confirm account is not in dormancy.
 - Ensure system is not undergoing maintenance.

- **Unable to View Balance**:
 - Clear app cache (mobile app users).
 - Update to the latest version of the banking app.
 - Try switching between NetBanking and Mobile Banking.

- **Mismatch Between ATM Slip and NetBanking Balance**:
 - Allow 24 hours for system sync.
 - Contact branch if discrepancy persists.

# Fund Transfer Issues

- **Transfer Failed**:
 - Confirm beneficiary details (account number, IFSC) are correct.
 - Check if daily transaction limit has been exceeded.
 - Retry after ensuring no ongoing maintenance.

- **NEFT/IMPS Delays**:
 - NEFT transactions may take up to 2 hours.
 - IMPS should reflect instantly; if delayed, check for downtime alerts.

- **UPI Transaction Declined**:
 - Ensure UPI PIN is correct.
 - Verify linked account has sufficient funds.
 - Confirm UPI app is updated to the latest version.

# Reset/Change Debit & Credit Card PIN – NetBanking / Mobile App

> Purpose: Generic workflow for card PIN reset/change via digital channels. Never ask for or store card numbers, CVV, or OTP in chat.

## Supported Channels
- **Mobile Banking App** (recommended)
- **NetBanking (Web)**
- **ATM** (fallback method if digital channels are unavailable)
- **Contact Center** (IVR may initiate an OTP-based self-service; agent will not ask for your PIN)

## Prerequisites
- Card must be **active** and **linked** to your customer profile.
- **Mobile number** must be updated for OTP.
- Your digital banking access must be **active**.

## Steps – Mobile Banking App
1. **Sign in** to the app.
2. Go to **Cards** → select your **Debit/Credit Card**.
3. Tap **Manage Card** → **Set/Reset PIN** (naming may vary).
4. Authenticate using **OTP / biometrics** as prompted.
5. Enter **new PIN** (follow on-screen complexity rules), then **confirm**.
6. You’ll get a success confirmation. **Do not share your PIN** with anyone.

## Steps – NetBanking (Web)
1. **Login** to NetBanking.
2. Navigate to **Cards** → **Debit/Credit Cards** → **PIN Services**.
3. Choose **Set/Reset PIN** for the specific card.
4. Verify using **OTP / grid card / 2FA** (as applicable).
5. Enter and confirm the **new PIN**; submit to complete.

## Steps – ATM (Fallback)
1. Insert card at a **bank ATM**.
2. Choose **PIN Services** → **Create/Change PIN**.
3. Authenticate (e.g., OTP to registered mobile).
4. Enter **new PIN** and confirm.

## Common Issues & Fixes
- **OTP not received**: Check mobile network, DND settings; retry; verify registered mobile number.
- **Card not visible**: Ensure the card is **active** and **mapped** to your profile; re-login; contact support if it persists.
- **PIN blocked after wrong attempts**: Wait for the cooldown period; then reset via the steps above.
- **App shows “feature unavailable”**: Try again later (maintenance window) or use another channel (NetBanking/ATM).

## Security Reminders

ait for the cooldown period; then reset via the steps above.
- **App shows “feature unavailable”**: Try again later (maintenance window) or use another channel (NetBanking/ATM).

## Security Reminders
- **Never** share full card number, CVV, or PIN over chat/phone/email.
- Bank staff will **never** ask for your PIN.
- Change your PIN periodically and avoid obvious patterns.

# Fixed Deposit (FD) – Interest Rates (Policy Overview)

> Purpose: Provide **policy-style** guidance. Do **not** state live rates unless explicitly provided in official documents.

## Key Points
- **Rates are dynamic** and vary by **tenure**, **deposit amount**, **customer category** (e.g., senior citizen), and **channel** (branch vs online).
- Banks typically publish current FD rates on the **official website → Deposits → Fixed Deposits → Interest Rates** page.
- **Senior citizen** rates are usually **higher** (additional spread over card rates).
- **Special tenures** (e.g., 444/555 days) may carry promotional rates.

## Safe Guidance
- Always verify **latest rates** on the bank’s official site or authenticated internal content.
- If rates are not in the knowledge base, respond: 
 _“I don’t have the current FD rates in the bank’s knowledge base. Please check the official rates page or contact your branch.”_

## Typical Factors Affecting FD Rate
- Tenure: 7 days to 10 years
- Amount bucket: Retail vs. Bulk (≥ threshold as per bank policy)
- Customer category: Resident / NRE / NRO / Senior citizen
- Payout option: **Cumulative** (interest compounded & paid at maturity) vs **Non-cumulative** (monthly/quarterly payouts)

## Disclaimers
- Premature withdrawal may **reduce the effective return** and could attract a penalty as per policy.
- Tax Deducted at Source (TDS) may apply as per prevailing laws.
- Interest rates for **NRE/NRO** accounts may follow separate policy guidelines.

## Where to Check Official Rates
- Official website → **Deposits** → **Fixed Deposits** → **Interest Rates**
- NetBanking/Mobile Banking → **Open FD** flow (rate is shown before confirmation)
- Branch notice board / rate circulars
